headline: Yummy Sweet Potato Casserole
description: A creamy sweet potato casserole with a crunchy pecan topping. Easy to make ahead, this recipe is the perfect side dish for your holiday meal.

video.description: This sweet potato casserole is sure to become a holiday favorite.
video.name: Yummy Sweet Potato Casserole

name: Yummy Sweet Potato Casserole

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Prepare sweet potatoes: Put sweet potatoes in a medium saucepan and cover with water. Cook over medium-high heat until tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain and transfer to a large bowl.
Mash drained sweet potatoes with a fork. Add eggs; mix until well combined. Add sugar, milk, butter, vanilla, and salt; mix until smooth. Transfer to a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Make topping: Mix brown sugar and flour together in a medium bowl. Cut in butter with a pastry cutter until mixture is coarse and looks like peas; don't overmix. Stir in pecans. Sprinkle topping over sweet potato mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until topping is lightly browned, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Added 2tbs of Nutmeg. Used 1 bag of mini marshmallows for the topping instead. Was quite good!
This was very bland. Needed some type of spice such as cinnamon. The topping did not melt and lacked flavor also. Going back to my old recipe. Followed recipe exactly as written.

Great recipe! However, one suggestion I will make is to bake the sweet potatoes instead of boiling them in water. This way, it will retain all of the nutrients that would otherwise be lost from boiling them. It would also make the casserole a lot more flavorful.
It was ok.
Made the recipe as is and it was fantastic. Thank you Noni for the tip on peeling sweet pots, I will try that next time. The ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù button does not work.

I love this recipe but do adjust it slightly. I bake the sweet potatoes which makes them plenty sweet so I do not add the white sugar into the casserole, just the brown sugar crumble on top with lots of extra pecans.
I use canned sweet potatoes several times and it still turns out amazing ! I always quadruple the topping and if I have extra I can always ad it on top. Everyone always raves about this recipe.

Peeling sweet potatoes is hard work. My grandmother taught me this trick: scrub your sweet potatoes, but don't peel them. Put them in a deep pot; cover with water and bring to a boil. Simmer for 20-30 minutes, depending on size of potatoes, until fork tender. Allow to cool until you can handle them. The peels slip right off! Finish recipe as written.

I‚Äôve been making this for twenty years and everyone loves it. When I‚Äôve taken it to get togethers there are always requests for the recipe. I did make it with boiled potatoes and I didn‚Äôt think it was nearly as flavorful as baking them.
Delicious!

Based on suggestions from other reviewers, I baked my sweet potatoes - so easy! I also halved the sugar, doubled the vanilla, and added cinnamon and nutmeg to taste. Used an 8x8 Pyrex dish and topped it with half the pecan mix and the other half with marshmallows. So delicious - and a big hit!
It was awesome! Over the top with marshmallows.
Love this-it's almost like a dessert.

Yum! This was delicious but I did make a few changes. I used drained canned sweet potatoes since I had already bought them, and I used brown sugar instead of white plus added some cinnamon to it. My adult kids finished it off with their breakfast the next morning.
A favorite for all of this kids and a Thanksgiving tradition around here
I actually made this with canned yams that I drained and mashed with a fork. They were delicious!!

I always make candied yams for Thanksgiving, but I baked the yams too long. This was a great alternative. I did not add the white sugar to the potato mixture, but followed it exactly. This was great! Everyone loved it! I'll be making it again.
Loved it! I didn‚Äôt put sugar in the potatoes themselves and they were perfect. The sweetness of the potatoes and the sweetness from the topping were perfect. Will save this to make again and again.

This was delicious and pretty easy to make. I added cinnamon and nutmeg, probably 3/4 tsp each, or slightly less to your taste. It took 10 more minutes to bake to get the topping crisp. A reviewer said the 9x13 casserole is too large, it comes out pretty flat, so I used a smaller one about 2 qt. That was perfect. A family member said it was so good, they want me to make/bring it to all the gatherings..
Everyone loves it! My best favorite is the topping üòÅ of course very sugary but delicious.
Not tasty at all. Waste time and ingredients. Would not recommend to anyone. Poor choice

I used 4 large sweet potatoes. Didn't want to take the shortcut of canned because I wanted to make it special. After all, it is Thanksgiving. I followed the recipe, mostly. I don't like really sweet sweet potato casserole so I cut down on the white sugar a little. There could have been a little more topping but, again, I didn't want to turn it into a dessert. It was a big hit.

Delicious! For those watching sugar, I left the sugar out of the sweet potato portion (leaving it only in the topping) and it still tasted great. Aside from trying to cut down on sugar, I was looking forward to a less "sweet" side, letting the sweet potatoes speak for themselves (and not trying to compete w/the pumpkin pie!). The game-changer was that I also used an immersion blender. This made the casserole so light and fluffy, it was like eating air!

I knew from the start I wasn‚Äôt going to add sugar or vanilla. I find sweet potatoes sweet enough. I used the other ingredients, but I baked it in an 8x8 pan. Had to bake it 10 minutes longer, and popped it under the broiler for 2 minutes. Everyone loved it!
I made this for thanksgiving. It was amazing. Everyone loved it. I followed Melissa and added vanilla, nutmeg and cinnamon.

Not everyone likes Sweet potatoes. Brought it for a side to share on Thanksgiving. Heard a lot of good remarks and everyone loved this. I made this before, but this time I changed the recipe . I layer some of the topping 1/2 way thru the layers of sweet the potatoes. Apply more sweet potatoes & then the topping as directed. I use larger pieces of Praline Pecans to finish the top. The Praline Pecans are much tastier than the regular Pecans.

I pretty much make this every Thanksgiving. I use one large canned yams to quicken the process, especially since you already have enough to do when making a big feast. This is my go to for sweet potato casserole. Reminds me a bit of the Boston Market recipe with their yummy, Crunchy topping. I always make double the topping as that's my favorite part and I use whatever nuts I have laying around and chop em in my food processor (usually mixed nuts from Costco)

I subbed heavy cream for the milk because hey it's Thanksgiving! I also used 2/3 cups of brown sugar, flour, and pecans because we love the topping. Also, instead of white sugar, I used pure cane sugar, and we thought it turned out even better. This is a great recipe even if you follow the recipe perfectly, but I like using things that we love to make it even better.

Important tip: DOUBLE the amount of sweet potatoes in this recipe. Keep all other ingredients same. I have been making this for years, and it‚Äôs always great! (But you‚Äôve got to DOUBLE the sweet potatoes!).
I subsituted coconut sugar,coconut milk, and coconut oil in both topping and sweet potatoes, taste more like a candy bar.

I used 8 large sweet potatoes. Boiled them with skins on until they were soft to pierce with a fork. Drained and cooled. Skins came right off. Easy to mash. Did not double anything else. Followed recipe. Will definitely make again!
I make this every year and its always a big hit. I use half the suggested sugar in the sweet potatoes, but that‚Äôs just my preference. I feel like its more a dessert if its too sweet

I have made this recipe several times and I love it! I cannot make just a single batch because it will not be enough. The only changes I made to this recipe other than the type of sweet potato (I have made it with gold sweet potatoes mixed with the orange ones. I have also made purple sweet potatoes and gold sweet potatoes mixed) is that I add about a half can of pineapple that I crushed to each casserole so when I make a double batch I use a a full can. When you use the pineapple you don't need any sugar. Add a half a cup of sour cream per casserole and it really brings out the flavor! You're welcome! (Add a half a cup of sour cream for any sweet casserole or sweet bread that you make and you will triple the love for it!)
This became out favorite sweet potato casserole ever, it is delicious and my family asks for it every thanksgiving celebration, thank you for share this recipe.
Family‚Äôs favorite Thanksgiving Dish!
Absolutely love this! Make it every Thanksgiving.

I‚Äôve been making this recipe since I found it in 2006. My family now always asks for this at Thanksgiving and Christmas and it is my husband‚Äôs absolute favorite dish of mine. He says it reminds him sweet potato pie. It is creamy, sweet, and delicious. The brown sugar and pecans add a great little crunch. I use half the white sugar it calls for and it‚Äôs still so delicious.
It was really good.

Hmmmm, 4 cups of cubed sweet potatoes in my 9x13 dish gives me about 1 inch of sweet potatoes. After baking for 30 minutes it turned out thin and dry. Did anyone try this recipe before posting it here???

The name says it all. One note: I used a hand blender to blend the ingredients and mash the potatoes. I added a handful of chopped pecans to the topping after it was spread on the potato mixture...can't have too many pecans.
I make this recipe every Christmas, it is always a big hit. Everyone loves it
Super yummy, just as I'd expect. Perfect comfort food!
This was awesome!
Made this recipe at Thanksgiving - everybody loved it! Comments were that it needed more pecans though.
This is the best side dish. I make it every year!

As written, this is much too sweet for my taste. I have made this twice and tweaked the second version and it's much better, in my opinion. I used 2 tablespoons of brown sugar and 1/4 cup of real maple syrup. I also added cinnamon, about a teaspoon or so. I added 1 teaspoon of my homemade vanilla extract that I made using bourbon. I skipped the entire topping as we like ours topped with marshmallows. Also, I baked off the sweet potatoes rather than boiling them. I find that the sweet potato flavor gets lost in the whole boiling process, while baking them concentrates that flavor. As written, I'd give the recipe 2 stars. With my tweaks, I give it 4.5. I split the difference with you.

This was awesome. It says to put in a 9 x 13 but I put in 9 x 9 square - made following the recipe it doesn't serve many. It was perfect. I followed the recipe and went shy on the sugar. Will definitely add this to our Thanksgiving and Christmas dinners!

This recipe is delicious! The only change I recommend, if you have time- clean and pierce your potatoes with a fork and bake in a preheated 425 degree oven until tender-40 min to an hour depending on the size. Once cooled the peel comes off easily.

I LOVE sweet potatoes! But 1 thing I would HIGHLY recommend is to not boil them, roast them! I caramelizes the natural sugars and the flavor is SO much better! Also, it allows you to cut the added sugar to the recipe. I typically add a few tablespoons of light brown sugar, cinnamon, butter, & a little heavy cream before mashing. Then add to your casserole dish and top with your pecan crumble mixture. Always a staple at any holiday dinner & never have leftovers!
Actually omitted the white sugar and added cinnamon plus added mini marshmallows on top broiled golden brown
I‚Äôve been making this recipe for a few years now both for thanksgiving and for Christmas it‚Äôs always a huge huge hit! I do double the crumble topping !! Mmmmmmm
Add a little bit of cinnamon.
The recipe was very easy to follow and it is delicious, love it!
Delicious! I made extra topping, but one can never have too much topping. I also added cinnamon.
Added more sweet potatoes, but left the rest of it the same. Used an egg beater to mash and mix. Tasted wonderful. But is it a vegetable, a desert, or both in one?
no changes made it as in recipe

10 stars!!! A must for every thanksgiving and Christmas meals! I've made it several times and OMG it's so good. Indeed 1/2 cup of sugar and the pecan crumble on top make it way too sweet. I've cut the sugar down to a little over 1/4 cup and it's perfect. For the sake of my daughter, after it's baked, I layer marshmallows as well and broil it till golden. I suggest that before you add the eggs to start slow on sugar and go by taste. Lllllllove it!!!
So delicious

Thankfully I made this for myself before making it for company. It was so sweet, that it tasted like I was eating candy. Lots of white sugar flavor even after reducing the amount of added sugar. I had to discard the final product. If,I were to try it again, I would add spices, roast the sweet potatoes and add a tiny amount of brown sugar, although I think the topping adds plenty of sugar. UGH.
I made this dish for Thanksgiving and it was a huge hit. I made it again for Christmas and nothing was left for me. Easy and delicious.
This is my favorite type of yam casserole. I prefer a custard, and this is a very easy one. My family enjoyed it!
Awesome! I substituted white sugar with raw cane sugar. Also used tapioca flour instead of eggs because I‚Äôm vegan!
Followed directions and added some secret ingredients! OMG family loves this! Picture is before I put the marshmallows on :)

All these years I didn't realize that sweet potatoes could be made and taste great! This recipe is easy and very delicious. For those who don't like super smooth potatoes, mix a little less to leave whatever lumps you desire.
Amazing! My husband loved this and we plan on having it every Thanksgiving.
Always a hit att gatherings! So good!!!
This recipe was a hit on my Thanksgiving table. The topping is what made it so special. You should try it !!!!!!
Excellent recipe. This was a crowd pleaser. I had many left overs of all the other items, but this bowl was scraped clean. I doubled the recipe but it still wasn't enough. Thank you

This is so good! I'll be honest-- I'm not sure if I used too many or enough sweet potatoes. And I needed a vegan version of this so I used it milk and margarine in it.

I have an extra pie shell from my pack of 4; I'm going to make the sweet potato casserole as a sweet potato pie- it's that good!
Tripling the potato mixture was the best idea. This is phenomenal and my entire immediate and extended family all love it and ask for it every year at Thanksgiving and Christmas.

This is a fantastic recipe and I‚Äôve been making it for years to everyone‚Äôs delight. I do recommend: I drop the white sugar entirely, the brown sugar adds flavor but it‚Äôs plenty sweet as is, no need for the white sugar. Also, I LOVE using candied bourbon pecans on top rather than normal pecans. It really adds something!
This recipe is amazing... my family and friends loved it.

The tip at the bottom of the recipe is very confusing. Is there supposed to be 4 cups of sweet potato or 12? If the latter, why not just update the recipe and get rid of the "tip"? I made it with 4c and indeed it seemed like a very little amount of mixture for a 9x13 baking dish. I moved it to a dish about half the size, but definitely wished after the fact that I had at least doubled the recipe.
I have been making this casserole for over 20 years. the only difference I have made is scaled the recipe to yield a higher amount. thank you Tina B for submitting the recipe!!

It was extremely liked by all . I got requests for this from many of my guests,. I dubbled the topping recipe and added marshmallows. Will be making more often fo shizzle. Don't forget the marshmallows!
It was delish!

I am requested to make this every holiday for my family...and I don't even like sweet potatoes. I will be traveling this year and wonder if I can make ahead and keep refrigerated then add topping and bake when we get there
A big hit at Christmas!!
Yummy is right!

If you want a deeper taste from your sweet potatoes bake them in your oven, let them cool, and remove the skin. Mash the cooked sweet potatoes and continue with recipe. It‚Äôs easier than peeling and cutting the sweet potatoes into cubes and tastes much better.

bake the potatoes with skin on for 1-1.5 hours at 425 (about 4 medium potatoes = 3 cups) it'll be easy to scoop the meat out of the skin once they are baked, so no need to peel the potatoes. double the potatoes and topping if using a 9x13, and add marshmallows. no need to double anything if using an 8x8.

Way too sweet. It made it inedible for me. I like the idea of the recipe, but you could probably skip the sugar altogether in the topping, and cut it in half for the sweet potatoes or substitute maple syrup instead. Definitely cut back on the sugar!

Used 10 c mashed sweet potatoes (4 large SPs baked 1.5 hrs), 3 beaten eggs, 4 tbs butter, 1 tsp vanilla, and pinch of cinnamon, nutmeg, & salt but NO MILK as the texture was perfect without it. The topping was exactly from the recipe. The result was fantastic; everyone loved it. I will definitely be making this again.

Sweet potato anything is one of my favorite things and THIS casserole was absolutely perfect! My family and guests loved it! I followed a couple of other suggestions and in the potato mixture did part white sugar and part brown sugar, I didn‚Äôt have any regular milk so I added 1/4 c condensed milk and 1/4 half and half. Everything else was by the recipe and it was sooooo good. Thinking I‚Äôm going to have some this morning with my coffee!!!
Someone made this for a potluck at work and I had to have the recipe. We are not normally sweet potato eaters, but this is a new favorite for holiday dinners. No changes
I loved this but I did make substitutions

love this, and review suggestions. 
Just one thing, I CAN'T make Sweet Potato Casserole 
without miniture marshmellows! 
It's practically a SIN!
We really liked it. It‚Äôs not as dry as some of the other recipes for sweet potato casserole or as overwhelmingly sweet.
This was so easy and everyone loved it. If you want a great desert to go with a meal you served this just make two batches and plate the second batch. It‚Äôs a side and a desert.
This Recipe is great!!!
Wonderful!

My favorite Thanksgiving dish! I use evaporated milk instead of regular milk. I also put a little extra vanilla and double the topping. It‚Äôs always a hit. Please roast real sweet potatoes. The canned stuff is garbage!!

My family and I totally enjoyed this recipe, the only difference I did was I roasted my sweet potatoes in the oven for about an hour and half I just enjoy sweet potatoes roasted better and then mashed them. Absolutely tasty and wonderful totally would make again.
Very good, went over good at our Christmas dinner
Absolutely delicious, I used 1/2 the white sugar and it was plenty sweet.
Reduce the sugar to less than half, added cinnamon to the topping mix and doubled the Pecans.
Loved it. Good recipe

This recipe is superior to any other sweet potato casserole I‚Äôve ever eaten or made. My 2 year old is so picky, but she‚Äôll devour 2-3 servings of this! Thank you for the awesome recipe. The only change I made was baking my potatoes to maximize the natural sweetness. DELICIOUS!
Yummy!
